definitions.definition: Of a student, to fail a class; to not pass .
Of a teacher, to deny a student a passing grade.
examples: Unsatisfied with Fred's progress, the teacher flunked him.

definitions.definition: To back out through fear . (Commonly in the phrase 'flunk it', the 'it' referring to a specific task avoided;  sometimes without specific reference, describing a person's attitude to life in general.)

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) Of a student, to fail a class; to not pass .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) Of a teacher, to deny a student a passing grade.
( by extension ) To fail any challenge
( dated , informal ) To shirk (a task or duty).

To back out through fear . (Commonly in the phrase 'flunk it', the 'it' referring to a specific task avoided;  sometimes without specific reference, describing a person's attitude to life in general.)
